716630f-a.text:
Beaver Street, south side, east from
William, to and including Pearl Streets. Also shown is William Street, at the S.E. corner of Beaver Street.
Building shown is the N.Y. Cotton Exchange.
About 1890.
C. L. Ritzmann.
716630f-a.folder: Beaver Street & William Street, Manhattan, NY

716631f-a.text:
Beaver Street, south side, east from William, to and including Pearl Streets. Also shown is William Street, east side, south from and including Beaver Street, to but not including Hanover Square. Building concerned is the New York Cotton Exchange fronting on William Street,
between Beaver Street and Hanover Square.
About 1890.
P. L. Sperr.  (Taken by August Loeffler)
716631f-a.folder: Beaver Street & William Street, Manhattan, NY

716629f.text:
At. the intersection of Beaver and South William Streets, at William Street on the right, is Beaver Street, south side, west from William, to but not including New Streets. Also shown is South William Street, west from William, to, but not including Broad Streets. Building at the intersection is the Merchant Marine House, formerly "Delmonico's".
About 1920.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
716629f.folder: Beaver Street & William Street (South), Manhattan, NY

724778f-a.text:
(1)
William Street, south from and including South William Street. Showing prominently the 11-story Maritime Agency Building, No. 1-3 South William Street. William Street at that point veers to the left
and procedes in an eastward direction.
August 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
big.~ 113o
(2)
A view slightly westward and showing the curved apex of the Merchant Marine House, formerly Delmonico's,at the convergence of South William and Beaver Streets. The Maritime Agency appears on the extreme left. Nos. 5-7 and 9 South William Street, two low buildings, appear on opposite corners of Mill Lane; the first being occupied by Chubb and
Son.
About 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
724778f-a.folder: William Street & South William Street, Manhattan, NY

P. L. Sperr.
big.~ 113o
(2)
A view slightly westward and showing the curved apex of the Merchant Marine House, formerly Delmonico's,at the convergence of South William and Beaver Streets. The Maritime Agency appears on the extreme left. Nos. 5-7 and 9 South William Street, two low buildings, appear on opposite corners of Mill Lane; the first being occupied by Chubb and

724782f-a.text:
22 William Street, east side, from Beaver Street to Exchange Place, showing the lower portion of the 59-storied City Bank Farmers Trust Co. occupying this entire block and known by the above location. This view is in a southward direction and shows-fortress like square structure of the National City Bank in the foreground which also borders on this street. Photographers vantage point was the 70-storied Bank of Manhattan Building, at No. 40 Wall Street, which permitted a perspective of the confluence of the East and North Rivers, at the Upper Bay; the latter with Governors Island therein. This set of 3 views shows different portions of this
new edifice.
March 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
724782f-a.folder: William Street & Beaver Street, Manhattan, NY

722480f-a.text:
Pearl Street, east from William Street, showing a Manhattan locale known as Hanover Square. The "gg1' station shown pears this identification. This is one of the stops on the South Ferry extension of the 2nd and 3rd Avenue lines. Vhru the trncks anxar portions of the City 3ank Farmers Trust Co.Building and its adjacent Wall and Panover Building. At the lower left is the entrance to the Coffee Exchange. Odors of this commodity and various spices permeate the
entire district.
March 6, 1936
Berenice Abbott, Photo
Federal Art Project

716628f-a.text:
Beaver Street, east from and across William Street, showing prominently the new 35 story Wall and Hanover Building. This fronts on Hanover Street, extending from Beaver to Wnll Street. At the rear of same and occupying the apex of this triangular block is the 25 story Munson S. S. Line Building. This point is where Bearer
Street converges with Wall Street.
Note excavation work in the foreground of View 2 where former low buildings of the Farmers Loan and Trust Co. and the Canadian Bank of Commerce stood. Upon this site will rise the 59 story City Bank Farmers Trust Co.
Building.
These views are taken from the Ketr Building, at No. 38-46 Beaver Street and are across the low triangular roof of the MerchantMarine Hotel (formerly Delmonicos).
View 1: August 20, 1929
View 2: October 5, 1929
P. L. Sperr
716628f-a.folder: Beaver Street & William Street, Manhattan, NY

Note excavation work in the foreground of View 2 where former low buildings of the Farmers Loan and Trust Co. and the Canadian Bank of Commerce stood. Upon this site will rise the 59 story City Bank Farmers Trust Co.

(1)
wo. 1 Hanover Square, south side, betweew Stone (right), to Pearl (lft) Streets, showing the India aouse. Also show is Stone Street, west side, south from Hanover Square to Mill Lane, with the Maritime Agency building (part of which is shown), at the S.W. corner of Stone Street. Adjoining same, is the 4-story building of Chubb & Son at the N.W. corner of Mill Lane.
August 21, 1929.
'. L. Sperr.
(2)

-2 E 22
1923.
